pageContext.claim: “We have the biggest rallies in the history of politics and nobody has rallies like this.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump often has empty seats at rallies and routinely exaggerates how many people attended. He can't claim to have the biggest political crowds in U.S. history. Reagan attracted huge crowds. For instance, in 1984, a Reagan rally attracted 100,000 people to a rally in Doylestown, about two hours away from Hersey, Penna., where Trump spoke to a crowd estimated to be about 10,000 people.
